author: Unknown
text:
Here in Nevada, comprehensive planning for the future of our communities is suffering due to the economic crisis.  Of course, planning is no longer considered a "core" service of some local governments  in these economic times.  I would love to hear from managers and CD directors about your experiences elsewhere in the U.S.  Is this trend of de-emphasizing long-range planning pervasive or regional in nature?  
Thanks for your responses,
Adrian P. Freund, FAICP, Planning Consultant
freundassociates@gmail.com
title: Is comprehensive planning suffering in your community due to the current economic crisis?
